<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Here we will consider the marathon runners listed in this <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_world_records_in_masters_athletics">wikipedia page</a>.</p>
<p>This post will consider various generalized linear models (GLMS) with different families.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span class="code-line"><span></span><span class="n">timesm</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="nf">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">123.98</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">128.633</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">134.266</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">139.484</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">139.533</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">156.5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">161.95</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">174.8</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">184.9</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">195.9</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">236.567</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">340.017</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">505.283</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">timesf</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="nf">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">139.316</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">144.893</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">149.00</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">151.083</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">170.55</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">181.5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">192.95</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">215.483</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">233.7</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">252.733</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">314.433</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">533.133</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">agem</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="nf">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">35</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">40</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">45</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">50</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">55</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">60</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">65</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">70</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">75</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">80</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">85</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">90</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">100</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">agef</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="nf">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">35</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">40</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">45</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">50</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">55</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">60</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">65</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">70</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">75</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">80</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">85</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">90</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">agemsq</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="n">agem^2</span></span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">time</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="nf">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timesf</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">timesm</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">age</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="nf">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">agef</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">agem</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">gender</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="nf">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nf">rep</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">12</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="nf">rep</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">13</span><span class="p">))</span></span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">marathon</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="nf">data.frame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">time</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">age</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">gender</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">head</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">marathon</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<table>
<thead><tr><th scope=col>time</th><th scope=col>age</th><th scope=col>gender</th></tr></thead>
<tbody>
	<tr><td>139.316</td><td>35     </td><td>1      </td></tr>
	<tr><td>144.893</td><td>40     </td><td>1      </td></tr>
	<tr><td>149.000</td><td>45     </td><td>1      </td></tr>
	<tr><td>151.083</td><td>50     </td><td>1      </td></tr>
	<tr><td>170.550</td><td>55     </td><td>1      </td></tr>
	<tr><td>181.500</td><td>60     </td><td>1      </td></tr>
</tbody>
</table>

</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>First, let's do an ordinary linear regression model with a Gaussian response variable assumption.</p>
<h1 id="Linear-Regression-(Gaussian)">Linear Regression (Gaussian)<a class="anchor-link" href="#Linear-Regression-(Gaussian)">¶</a></h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span class="code-line"><span></span><span class="n">lin1</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="nf">lm</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timesm</span><span class="o">~</span><span class="n">agem</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">marathon</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">lin2</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="nf">lm</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timesm</span><span class="o">~</span><span class="n">agem</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">agemsq</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">marathon</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">summary</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">lin1</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">summary</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">lin2</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea ">
<pre><span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Call:</span>
<span class="code-line">lm(formula = timesm ~ agem, data = marathon)</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Residuals:</span>
<span class="code-line">   Min     1Q Median     3Q    Max </span>
<span class="code-line">-70.80 -47.41 -15.95  28.83 149.61 </span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Coefficients:</span>
<span class="code-line">            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    </span>
<span class="code-line">(Intercept)  -89.203     62.054  -1.438  0.17841    </span>
<span class="code-line">agem           4.449      0.910   4.889  0.00048 ***</span>
<span class="code-line">---</span>
<span class="code-line">Signif. codes:  0 *** 0.001 ** 0.01 * 0.05 . 0.1   1</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Residual standard error: 63.52 on 11 degrees of freedom</span>
<span class="code-line">Multiple R-squared:  0.6848,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.6562 </span>
<span class="code-line">F-statistic:  23.9 on 1 and 11 DF,  p-value: 0.0004801</span>
</pre>
</div>

</div>

<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea ">
<pre><span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Call:</span>
<span class="code-line">lm(formula = timesm ~ agem + agemsq, data = marathon)</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Residuals:</span>
<span class="code-line">    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max </span>
<span class="code-line">-47.811 -15.503   5.468  19.742  40.354 </span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Coefficients:</span>
<span class="code-line">             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    </span>
<span class="code-line">(Intercept) 498.57207   98.79145   5.047 0.000502 ***</span>
<span class="code-line">agem        -14.89307    3.13305  -4.754 0.000776 ***</span>
<span class="code-line">agemsq        0.14557    0.02335   6.233 9.72e-05 ***</span>
<span class="code-line">---</span>
<span class="code-line">Signif. codes:  0 *** 0.001 ** 0.01 * 0.05 . 0.1   1</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Residual standard error: 30.14 on 10 degrees of freedom</span>
<span class="code-line">Multiple R-squared:  0.9355,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.9226 </span>
<span class="code-line">F-statistic: 72.49 on 2 and 10 DF,  p-value: 1.118e-06</span>
</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Based on the summary, it appears that the quadratic term is quite important, it increases the R-squared significantly. So there does appear to be a quadratic effect of age on the time (or at the very least, a non-linear one).</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span class="code-line"><span></span><span class="n">lin3</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="nf">lm</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">time</span><span class="o">~</span><span class="n">age</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">gender</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">summary</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">lin3</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea ">
<pre><span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Call:</span>
<span class="code-line">lm(formula = time ~ age + gender)</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Residuals:</span>
<span class="code-line">   Min     1Q Median     3Q    Max </span>
<span class="code-line">-74.18 -42.85 -14.10  26.96 181.20 </span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Coefficients:</span>
<span class="code-line">             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    </span>
<span class="code-line">(Intercept) -104.3254    48.9768  -2.130   0.0446 *  </span>
<span class="code-line">age            4.6801     0.6979   6.706 9.68e-07 ***</span>
<span class="code-line">gender        35.0534    25.7576   1.361   0.1873    </span>
<span class="code-line">---</span>
<span class="code-line">Signif. codes:  0 *** 0.001 ** 0.01 * 0.05 . 0.1   1</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Residual standard error: 64.15 on 22 degrees of freedom</span>
<span class="code-line">Multiple R-squared:  0.6749,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.6454 </span>
<span class="code-line">F-statistic: 22.84 on 2 and 22 DF,  p-value: 4.285e-06</span>
</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Here, the model shows that gender has some part in determining the time (in seconds) of completion, but it is not significant. If the coefficient is correct, it means that, holding age constant, a man will have 35.0534 faster time (or a woman will take 35.0534 additional seconds) to finish the race.</p>
<p>Comparing the intercepts in the models shows a pretty large difference in the predictions. The reason why the male-only intercept is different from the intercept in the second model is because the second model is not considering the interaction of age and gender. When you account for this in the model, the intercepts will be the same. The gender coefficient in the model assumes that you are holding everything else constant, that is, the difference between a 35 year old male and female, for instance. When you consider the interaction term as well, this problem is eliminated.</p>
<h1 id="Gamma-Distribution">Gamma Distribution<a class="anchor-link" href="#Gamma-Distribution">¶</a></h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span class="code-line"><span></span><span class="n">gammalin1</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="nf">glm</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timesm</span><span class="o">~</span><span class="n">agem</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">family</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"Gamma"</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">summary</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">gammalin1</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea ">
<pre><span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Call:</span>
<span class="code-line">glm(formula = timesm ~ agem, family = "Gamma")</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Deviance Residuals: </span>
<span class="code-line">      Min         1Q     Median         3Q        Max  </span>
<span class="code-line">-0.169540  -0.067254   0.001897   0.092610   0.116811  </span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Coefficients:</span>
<span class="code-line">              Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    </span>
<span class="code-line">(Intercept)  1.275e-02  5.748e-04   22.17 1.76e-10 ***</span>
<span class="code-line">agem        -1.057e-04  6.839e-06  -15.46 8.30e-09 ***</span>
<span class="code-line">---</span>
<span class="code-line">Signif. codes:  0 *** 0.001 ** 0.01 * 0.05 . 0.1   1</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">(Dispersion parameter for Gamma family taken to be 0.009790868)</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">    Null deviance: 2.42365  on 12  degrees of freedom</span>
<span class="code-line">Residual deviance: 0.10997  on 11  degrees of freedom</span>
<span class="code-line">AIC: 116.42</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4</span>
</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The link function here is the canonical link function for the Gamma distribution, which is the inverse ($\frac{1}{\mu}$). All variables come up as significant.</p>
<p>The model can be written as follows
    $Y = X\beta + \epsilon$ where Y follows a Gamma distribution with link function $g(\mu) = \frac{1}{\mu}$</p>
<h1 id="Inverse-Gaussian-distribution">Inverse-Gaussian distribution<a class="anchor-link" href="#Inverse-Gaussian-distribution">¶</a></h1><p>The exponential family has the following form:
$$
f(y,\theta ,\phi ) = e^{\frac{y \theta - b(\theta )}{a(\phi )} + c(y, \phi)}
$$
The inverse-Gaussian distribution is defined as:
$$
f(y) = \exp (-\frac{\lambda (y - \mu )^2)}{2\mu ^2y} - \frac{1}{2} \log (\frac{2\pi y^3}{\lambda}))
$$
$$
f(y) = \exp (-\frac{\lambda (y^2 - 2y\mu + \mu ^2)}{2\mu ^2y} - \frac{1}{2} \log (\frac{2\pi y^3}{\lambda}))
$$
$$
f(y) = \exp (\lambda [-\frac{y}{2\mu ^2} + \frac{1}{\mu}] - \frac{\lambda }{2y} - \frac {1}{2}\log(\frac {2\pi y^3}{\lambda}))
$$
$$
f(y) = \exp (\frac {[-\frac{y}{2\mu ^2} + \frac{1}{\mu}]}{\frac {1}{\lambda}} - \frac{\lambda }{2y} - \frac {1}{2}\log(\frac {2\pi y^3}{\lambda}))
$$</p>
<p>This is in the exponential form, that is, $$\theta = - \frac {1} {2 \mu ^2}$$ 
$$a(\phi) = \frac {1}{\lambda} = { \phi}$$ 
$$b(\theta) = - \frac {1}{\mu} = -\sqrt{2 \theta}$$
$$c(y,\theta) = - \frac{\lambda}{2y} - \frac{1}{2}\log(\frac{2\pi y^3}{\lambda}) = - \frac{1}{y\phi} - \frac{1}{2}\log(2\pi \phi y^3)$$</p>
<p>$b'(\theta) = {\sqrt {\frac{2}{\theta }}} = \mu$   , which is $\text{E}(Y)$. The canonical link function is $g(\text{E}(Y))$ = $\theta$. So, the canonical link is proportional to  $\frac {1}{\mu ^2}$, which is equivalent to $X\beta$. The model is then
$Y = X\beta + \epsilon$ where Y follows a inverse Gaussian distribution with link function $g(\text{E}(Y))$ = 1/$\mu ^2$</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span class="code-line"><span></span><span class="n">invgauslin1</span>  <span class="o"><-</span>  <span class="nf">glm</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timesm</span><span class="o">~</span><span class="n">agem</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">family</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"inverse.gaussian"</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">summary</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">invgauslin1</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea ">
<pre><span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Call:</span>
<span class="code-line">glm(formula = timesm ~ agem, family = "inverse.gaussian")</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Deviance Residuals: </span>
<span class="code-line">       Min          1Q      Median          3Q         Max  </span>
<span class="code-line">-0.0048497  -0.0023005  -0.0000681   0.0005923   0.0123111  </span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Coefficients:</span>
<span class="code-line">              Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    </span>
<span class="code-line">(Intercept)  9.958e-05  3.892e-06   25.59 3.75e-11 ***</span>
<span class="code-line">agem        -9.617e-07  4.179e-08  -23.01 1.18e-10 ***</span>
<span class="code-line">---</span>
<span class="code-line">Signif. codes:  0 *** 0.001 ** 0.01 * 0.05 . 0.1   1</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">(Dispersion parameter for inverse.gaussian family taken to be 2.180685e-05)</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">    Null deviance: 0.01111018  on 12  degrees of freedom</span>
<span class="code-line">Residual deviance: 0.00020857  on 11  degrees of freedom</span>
<span class="code-line">AIC: 102.69</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4</span>
</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Both are quite difficult to interpret by themselves, as the response variables are transformed via the link function. The predictions for the gamma are as follows:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span class="code-line"><span></span><span class="nf">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">gammalin1</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">pred1</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="m">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="nf">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">gammalin1</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">pred2</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="m">1</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="nf">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">invgauslin1</span><span class="p">)))</span><span class="n">^.5</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">pred3</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="nf">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">lin1</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">sum</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">pred1</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">timesm</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="n">^2</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">sum</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">pred2</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">timesm</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="n">^2</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">sum</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">pred3</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">timesm</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="n">^2</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">sum</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="nf">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">lin2</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">timesm</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="n">^2</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Here, we can see the sum squared error of the transformed predictions from the models. We can see that the model using the gamma distribution does an exceptional job at predicting the response variable, time. It is better than both the linear and quadratic simple linear regression models. The inverse-gaussian performs the best out of the three candidate distributions.</p>
<p>Below, I do the same thing, except using the identity function. This produces more easily interpretable coefficients, but they are less efficient at predicting the model. That is, when we take the sum of squares, the identity links are less successful at determining the response.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span class="code-line"><span></span><span class="n">gammalin2</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="nf">glm</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timesm</span><span class="o">~</span><span class="n">agem</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">family</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"Gamma"</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">link</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"identity"</span><span class="p">))</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">summary</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">gammalin2</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">invgauslin2</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="nf">glm</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">timesm</span><span class="o">~</span><span class="n">agem</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">family</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"inverse.gaussian"</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">link</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">identity</span><span class="p">))</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">summary</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">invgauslin2</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">gammalin2</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">invgauslin2</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">sum</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="nf">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">gammalin2</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">timesm</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="n">^2</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">sum</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="nf">predict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">invgauslin2</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">timesm</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="n">^2</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
</pre></div>

entry.title: Mixed Models vs GEE
entry.summary: A look at the differences between Mixed Models and GEEs and when they may be more appropriate.
entry.content:
<style type="text/css">/*!
*

*
*/
/* CSS font colors for translated ANSI escape sequences */
/* The color values are a mix of
   http://www.xcolors.net/dl/baskerville-ivorylight and
   http://www.xcolors.net/dl/euphrasia */
.ansi-black-fg {
  color: #3E424D;
}
.ansi-black-bg {
  background-color: #3E424D;
}
.ansi-black-intense-fg {
  color: #282C36;
}

div.cell {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  border-radius: 2px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
  -moz-box-sizing: border-box;
  -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;
  border-width: 1px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: transparent;
  width: 100%;
  padding: 5px;
  /* This acts as a spacer between cells, that is outside the border */
  margin: 0px;
  outline: none;
  position: relative;
  overflow: visible;
}
div.cell:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: transparent;
}
div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-left-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-left-width: 1px;
  padding-left: 5px;
  border-right-color: #E3F2FD;
  border-right-width: 1px;
  background: #E3F2FD;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
div.cell.selected,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
  border-color: #ababab;
}
div.cell.selected:before,
div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #42A5F5;
}
@media print {
  div.cell.selected,
  div.cell.selected.jupyter-soft-selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected {
  border-color: #66BB6A;
}
.edit_mode div.cell.selected:before {
  position: absolute;
  display: block;
  top: -1px;
  left: -1px;
  width: 5px;
  height: calc(100% +  2px);
  content: '';
  background: #66BB6A;
}
@media print {
  .edit_mode div.cell.selected {
    border-color: transparent;
  }
}
.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */
  min-width: 14ex;
  /* This padding is tuned to match the padding on the CodeMirror editor. */
  padding: 0.4em;
  margin: 0px;
  font-family: monospace;
  text-align: right;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Don't highlight prompt number selection */
  -webkit-touch-callout: none;
  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;
  -moz-user-select: none;
  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;
  /* Use default cursor */
  cursor: default;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  .prompt {
    text-align: left;
  }
}
div.inner_cell {
  min-width: 0;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_area {
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  border-radius: 2px;
  background: #f7f7f7;
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* This is needed so that empty prompt areas can collapse to zero height when there
   is no content in the output_subarea and the prompt. The main purpose of this is
   to make sure that empty JavaScript output_subareas have no height. */
div.prompt:empty {
  padding-top: 0;
  padding-bottom: 0;
}
div.unrecognized_cell {
  padding: 5px 5px 5px 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell {
  border-radius: 2px;
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
  border: 1px solid #cfcfcf;
  background: #eaeaea;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.unrecognized_cell .inner_cell a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.unrecognized_cell > div.prompt {
    display: none;
  }
}
div.code_cell {
  /* avoid page breaking on code cells when printing */
}
@media print {
  div.code_cell {
    page-break-inside: avoid;
  }
}
/* any special styling for code cells that are currently running goes here */
div.input {
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.input {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
/* input_area and input_prompt must match in top border and margin for alignment */
div.input_prompt {
  color: #303F9F;
  border-top: 1px solid transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight {
  margin: 0.4em;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
div.input_area > div.highlight > pre {
  margin: 0px;
  border: none;
  padding: 0px;
  background-color: transparent;
}
/* The following gets added to the <head> if it is detected that the user has a
 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See
 * notebookmain.js.  Such fonts will have keywords vertically offset with
 * respect to the rest of the text.  The user should select a better font.
 * See: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1503
 *
 * .CodeMirror span {
 *      vertical-align: bottom;
 * }
 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  /* Changed from 1em to our global default */
  font-size: 14px;
  height: auto;
  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */
  background: none;
  /* Changed from white to allow our bg to show through */
}
.CodeMirror-scroll {
  /*  The CodeMirror docs are a bit fuzzy on if overflow-y should be hidden or visible.*/
  /*  We have found that if it is visible, vertical scrollbars appear with font size changes.*/
  overflow-y: hidden;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}
.CodeMirror-linenumber {
  padding: 0 8px 0 4px;
}
.CodeMirror-gutters {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 2px;
  border-top-left-radius: 2px;
}
.CodeMirror pre {
  /* In CM3 this went to 4px from 0 in CM2. This sets horizontal padding only,
    use .CodeMirror-lines for vertical */
  padding: 0 0.4em;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 0;
}
.CodeMirror-cursor {
  border-left: 1.4px solid black;
}
@media screen and (min-width: 2138px) and (max-width: 4319px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 2px solid black;
  }
}
@media screen and (min-width: 4320px) {
  .CodeMirror-cursor {
    border-left: 4px solid black;
  }
}

div.output_wrapper {
  /* this position must be relative to enable descendents to be absolute within it */
  position: relative;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
  z-index: 1;
}
/* class for the output area when it should be height-limited */
div.output_scroll {
  /* ideally, this would be max-height, but FF barfs all over that */
  height: 24em;
  /* FF needs this *and the wrapper* to specify full width, or it will shrinkwrap */
  width: 100%;
  overflow: auto;
  border-radius: 2px;
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  box-shadow: inset 0 2px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
  display: block;
}
/* output div while it is collapsed */
div.output_collapsed {
  margin: 0px;
  padding: 0px;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay {
  height: 100%;
  padding: 0px 0.4em;
  position: absolute;
  border-radius: 2px;
}
div.out_prompt_overlay:hover {
  /* use inner shadow to get border that is computed the same on WebKit/FF */
  -webkit-box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  box-shadow: inset 0 0 1px #000;
  background: rgba(240, 240, 240, 0.5);
}
div.output_prompt {
  color: #D84315;
}
/* This class is the outer container of all output sections. */
div.output_area {
  padding: 0px;
  page-break-inside: avoid;
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: horizontal;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: horizontal;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: horizontal;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row;
  align-items: stretch;
}
div.output_area .MathJax_Display {
  text-align: left !important;
}
div.output_area 
div.output_area 
div.output_area img,
div.output_area svg {
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
}
div.output_area img.unconfined,
div.output_area svg.unconfined {
  max-width: none;
}
div.output_area .mglyph > img {
  max-width: none;
}
/* This is needed to protect the pre formating from global settings such
   as that of bootstrap */
.output {
  /* Old browsers */
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  -webkit-box-align: stretch;
  display: -moz-box;
  -moz-box-orient: vertical;
  -moz-box-align: stretch;
  display: box;
  box-orient: vertical;
  box-align: stretch;
  /* Modern browsers */
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  align-items: stretch;
}
@media (max-width: 540px) {
  div.output_area {
    /* Old browsers */
    display: -webkit-box;
    -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
    -webkit-box-align: stretch;
    display: -moz-box;
    -moz-box-orient: vertical;
    -moz-box-align: stretch;
    display: box;
    box-orient: vertical;
    box-align: stretch;
    /* Modern browsers */
    display: flex;
    flex-direction: column;
    align-items: stretch;
  }
}
div.output_area pre {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 1px 0 1px 0;
  border: 0;
  vertical-align: baseline;
  color: black;
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 0;
}
/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  padding-top: 5px;
}
pre.raw_input_prompt {
  /* nothing needed here. */
}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {
  box-shadow: none;
}
p.p-space {
  margin-bottom: 10px;
}
div.output_unrecognized {
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
}
div.output_unrecognized a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.output_unrecognized a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
.rendered_html {
  color: #000;
  /* any extras will just be numbers: */
}



.rendered_html :link {
  text-decoration: underline;
}
.rendered_html :visited {
  text-decoration: underline;
}






.rendered_html h1:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.538em;
}
.rendered_html h2:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.636em;
}
.rendered_html h3:first-child {
  margin-top: 0.777em;
}
.rendered_html h4:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html h5:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html h6:first-child {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html ul:not(.list-inline),
.rendered_html ol:not(.list-inline) {
  padding-left: 2em;
}








.rendered_html * + ul {
  margin-top: 1em;
}
.rendered_html * + ol {
  margin-top: 1em;
}





.rendered_html pre,




.rendered_html tr,
.rendered_html th,


.rendered_html tbody tr:nth-child(odd) {
  background: #f5f5f5;
}
.rendered_html tbody tr:hover {
  background: rgba(66, 165, 245, 0.2);
}
.rendered_html * + table {
  margin-top: 1em;
}

.rendered_html * + p {
  margin-top: 1em;
}

.rendered_html * + img {
  margin-top: 1em;

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This is an example using 'fake' data for the difference between lmer (which assumes a constant (independent) covariance matrix for the error terms)
and geepack (general estimating equations, which can handle an unknown convariance structure))</p>
<p>This example highlights the power of using a GEE model over a HLM model when the covariance structure differs at different levels of the data. 
The GEE model can be seen as a population estimating model -- i.e., it is preferable when we are trying to make inferences about the population rather than the individuals in the sample. We do not explicitly parametrize over the groups -- instead, we assign some covariance structure between members of each group and find the marginal distribution.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The problem is formulated as follows: consider 6 athletes with characteristics given by:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span class="code-line"><span></span><span class="nf">library</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">lme4</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">library</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">geepack</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stderr output_text">
<pre><span class="code-line">Loading required package: Matrix</span>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span class="code-line"><span></span><span class="n">athlete</span><span class="o"><-</span><span class="nf">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">4</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">4</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">4</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">6</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">6</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">6</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">age</span><span class="o"><-</span><span class="nf">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">38</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">40</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">43</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">53</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">55</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">56</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">58</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">37</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">40</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">42</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">41</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">45</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">46</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">54</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">58</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">57</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">60</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">62</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">club</span><span class="o"><-</span><span class="nf">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">time</span><span class="o"><-</span><span class="nf">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">95</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">94</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">93</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">96</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">98</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">91</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">93</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">83</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">82</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">82</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">91</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">94</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">99</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">105</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">111</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">90</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">89</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">95</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">logtime</span><span class="o"><-</span><span class="nf">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">time</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This is an example of a repeated measures problem.</p>
<p>We create a dataframe from these elements:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span class="code-line"><span></span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o"><-</span><span class="nf">data.frame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">athlete</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">age</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">club</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">time</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">logtime</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">df</span></span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<table>
<thead><tr><th scope=col>athlete</th><th scope=col>age</th><th scope=col>club</th><th scope=col>time</th><th scope=col>logtime</th></tr></thead>
<tbody>
	<tr><td>1       </td><td>38      </td><td>0       </td><td> 95     </td><td>4.553877</td></tr>
	<tr><td>1       </td><td>40      </td><td>0       </td><td> 94     </td><td>4.543295</td></tr>
	<tr><td>1       </td><td>43      </td><td>1       </td><td> 93     </td><td>4.532599</td></tr>
	<tr><td>2       </td><td>53      </td><td>1       </td><td> 96     </td><td>4.564348</td></tr>
	<tr><td>2       </td><td>55      </td><td>1       </td><td> 98     </td><td>4.584967</td></tr>
	<tr><td>2       </td><td>56      </td><td>1       </td><td> 91     </td><td>4.510860</td></tr>
	<tr><td>2       </td><td>58      </td><td>1       </td><td> 93     </td><td>4.532599</td></tr>
	<tr><td>3       </td><td>37      </td><td>1       </td><td> 83     </td><td>4.418841</td></tr>
	<tr><td>3       </td><td>40      </td><td>1       </td><td> 82     </td><td>4.406719</td></tr>
	<tr><td>3       </td><td>42      </td><td>0       </td><td> 82     </td><td>4.406719</td></tr>
	<tr><td>4       </td><td>41      </td><td>0       </td><td> 91     </td><td>4.510860</td></tr>
	<tr><td>4       </td><td>45      </td><td>1       </td><td> 94     </td><td>4.543295</td></tr>
	<tr><td>4       </td><td>46      </td><td>0       </td><td> 99     </td><td>4.595120</td></tr>
	<tr><td>5       </td><td>54      </td><td>1       </td><td>105     </td><td>4.653960</td></tr>
	<tr><td>5       </td><td>58      </td><td>1       </td><td>111     </td><td>4.709530</td></tr>
	<tr><td>6       </td><td>57      </td><td>1       </td><td> 90     </td><td>4.499810</td></tr>
	<tr><td>6       </td><td>60      </td><td>1       </td><td> 89     </td><td>4.488636</td></tr>
	<tr><td>6       </td><td>62      </td><td>1       </td><td> 95     </td><td>4.553877</td></tr>
</tbody>
</table>

</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now, we want to estimate the (log) time based on age and club. However, the data is clearly correlated -- each individual will have different 
specifications. Consider that we believe that the average (log) time will be different for each individual, as a baseline. This is a mixed model
more specifically a Random Intercept model. This is highlighted by the following equations.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span class="code-line"><span></span><span class="n">mod1</span><span class="o"><-</span><span class="nf">lmer</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">logtime</span><span class="o">~</span><span class="n">club</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="nf">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">age</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="o">|</span><span class="n">athlete</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">REML</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">FALSE</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">mod2</span><span class="o"><-</span><span class="nf">lmer</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">logtime</span><span class="o">~</span><span class="nf">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">age</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="o">|</span><span class="n">athlete</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">REML</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">FALSE</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">summary</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mod1</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">summary</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mod2</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea ">
<pre><span class="code-line">Linear mixed model fit by maximum likelihood  ['lmerMod']</span>
<span class="code-line">Formula: logtime ~ club + log(age) + (1 | athlete)</span>
<span class="code-line">   Data: df</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">     AIC      BIC   logLik deviance df.resid </span>
<span class="code-line">   -49.2    -44.7     29.6    -59.2       13 </span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Scaled residuals: </span>
<span class="code-line">    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max </span>
<span class="code-line">-1.3445 -0.7551 -0.1840  0.7895  1.2651 </span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Random effects:</span>
<span class="code-line"> Groups   Name        Variance  Std.Dev.</span>
<span class="code-line"> athlete  (Intercept) 0.0042173 0.06494 </span>
<span class="code-line"> Residual             0.0008858 0.02976 </span>
<span class="code-line">Number of obs: 18, groups:  athlete, 6</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Fixed effects:</span>
<span class="code-line">            Estimate Std. Error t value</span>
<span class="code-line">(Intercept)  3.78158    0.45714   8.272</span>
<span class="code-line">club        -0.01049    0.02101  -0.499</span>
<span class="code-line">log(age)     0.19753    0.11837   1.669</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Correlation of Fixed Effects:</span>
<span class="code-line">         (Intr) club  </span>
<span class="code-line">club      0.184       </span>
<span class="code-line">log(age) -0.998 -0.216</pre>
</div>

</div>

<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea ">
<pre><span class="code-line">Linear mixed model fit by maximum likelihood  ['lmerMod']</span>
<span class="code-line">Formula: logtime ~ log(age) + (1 | athlete)</span>
<span class="code-line">   Data: df</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">     AIC      BIC   logLik deviance df.resid </span>
<span class="code-line">   -50.9    -47.4     29.5    -58.9       14 </span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Scaled residuals: </span>
<span class="code-line">    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max </span>
<span class="code-line">-1.3343 -0.6924 -0.3215  0.7936  1.2927 </span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Random effects:</span>
<span class="code-line"> Groups   Name        Variance  Std.Dev.</span>
<span class="code-line"> athlete  (Intercept) 0.0042948 0.06554 </span>
<span class="code-line"> Residual             0.0008962 0.02994 </span>
<span class="code-line">Number of obs: 18, groups:  athlete, 6</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Fixed effects:</span>
<span class="code-line">            Estimate Std. Error t value</span>
<span class="code-line">(Intercept)   3.8241     0.4527   8.448</span>
<span class="code-line">log(age)      0.1846     0.1164   1.586</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Correlation of Fixed Effects:</span>
<span class="code-line">         (Intr)</span>
<span class="code-line">log(age) -0.998</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>However, this assumes that the covariance structure of the errors at each level are independent. This assumption is too simplifying -- 
it is likely that the variables are correlated across individuals (for instance, it appears that the clubs are for particular age ranges). To account for this, we could add more random effects to the model (which would subsequently break the data down into even smaller groups), or we could use a GEE to forgo the subject-level estimations and estimate on the populations, assuming some covariance structure between groups.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span class="code-line"><span></span><span class="n">mod3</span><span class="o"><-</span><span class="nf">geeglm</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">logtime</span><span class="o">~</span><span class="n">club</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="nf">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">age</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">id</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">athlete</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">family</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">gaussian</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">corstr</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"exchangeable"</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="n">mod4</span><span class="o"><-</span><span class="nf">geeglm</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">logtime</span><span class="o">~</span><span class="nf">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">age</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">id</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">athlete</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">family</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">gaussian</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">corstr</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"exchangeable"</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">summary</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mod3</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
<span class="code-line"><span class="nf">summary</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">mod4</span><span class="p">)</span></span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea ">
<pre><span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Call:</span>
<span class="code-line">geeglm(formula = logtime ~ club + log(age), family = gaussian, </span>
<span class="code-line">    data = df, id = athlete, corstr = "exchangeable")</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line"> Coefficients:</span>
<span class="code-line">            Estimate  Std.err   Wald Pr(>|W|)    </span>
<span class="code-line">(Intercept)  3.67345  0.42962 73.109   <2e-16 ***</span>
<span class="code-line">club        -0.01429  0.01422  1.010   0.3149    </span>
<span class="code-line">log(age)     0.22584  0.11276  4.011   0.0452 *  </span>
<span class="code-line">---</span>
<span class="code-line">Signif. codes:  0 *** 0.001 ** 0.01 * 0.05 . 0.1   1</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Estimated Scale Parameters:</span>
<span class="code-line">            Estimate  Std.err</span>
<span class="code-line">(Intercept) 0.004443 0.001609</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Correlation: Structure = exchangeable  Link = identity </span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Estimated Correlation Parameters:</span>
<span class="code-line">      Estimate Std.err</span>
<span class="code-line">alpha   0.6112  0.1829</span>
<span class="code-line">Number of clusters:   6   Maximum cluster size: 4 </pre>
</div>

</div>

<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea ">
<pre><span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Call:</span>
<span class="code-line">geeglm(formula = logtime ~ log(age), family = gaussian, data = df, </span>
<span class="code-line">    id = athlete, corstr = "exchangeable")</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line"> Coefficients:</span>
<span class="code-line">            Estimate Std.err  Wald Pr(>|W|)    </span>
<span class="code-line">(Intercept)    3.742   0.488 58.84  1.7e-14 ***</span>
<span class="code-line">log(age)       0.206   0.127  2.61     0.11    </span>
<span class="code-line">---</span>
<span class="code-line">Signif. codes:  0 *** 0.001 ** 0.01 * 0.05 . 0.1   1</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Estimated Scale Parameters:</span>
<span class="code-line">            Estimate Std.err</span>
<span class="code-line">(Intercept)  0.00458 0.00154</span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Correlation: Structure = exchangeable  Link = identity </span>
<span class="code-line"></span>
<span class="code-line">Estimated Correlation Parameters:</span>
<span class="code-line">      Estimate Std.err</span>
<span class="code-line">alpha    0.624   0.181</span>
<span class="code-line">Number of clusters:   6   Maximum cluster size: 4 </pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The main shift in inference here is from likelihood models (which are generally prefered) to a semi-parametric model that depends only on the
first two moments. GEEs are better estimators of a population-level variance -- they cannot account for individual differences explicitly, as a GLMM could. In this example, however, we see that the GEE finds the log(age) value significant where the previous model had not. Depending on the 
goal of the analysis, the GEE will produce better estimates asymptotically at the cost of sample-level inference.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
